metadata.Title: CVE-2020-27827 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: A flaw was found in multiple versions of OpenvSwitch. Specially crafted LLDP packets can cause memory to be lost when allocating data to handle specific optional TLVs, potentially causing a denial of service. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.

criterions.comment: lldpd: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
openvswitch: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
